issue.title: Broken Checkbox UI
issue.body:
Checkbox component seems to be broken.
I can't fix or override styles issue. 

It looks as if Checkbox only works properly outside <View />. It also seems that it cannot be styled, resized, etc.

### Preview

https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/assets/391153/ac5082d8-3bae-404c-baff-6278788f591b


### What have you tried so far?
styling, 
change size,
change appearance IOS/Android

### Your Environment

| software                      | version
| --------------------- | -------
| ios                                | 17
├── base-64@1.0.0
├── expo-dev-client@2.4.8
├── expo-file-system@15.4.4
├── expo-splash-screen@0.20.5
├── expo-status-bar@1.6.0
├── expo-updates@0.18.12
├── expo@49.0.13
├── mobx-react@9.0.1
├── mobx@6.10.2
├── react-native-paper-select@1.0.2
├── react-native-paper@5.10.6
├── react-native-reanimated@3.3.0
├── react-native-safe-area-context@4.7.2
├── react-native-vector-icons@10.0.0
├── react-native@0.72.4
├── react@18.2.0

comment.body:
Remove the "height: 22" rule if it's not needed for your project or increase it. 
If it serves a specific purpose in your case, please let me know why, so we can work on a solution that accommodates your requirements.

issue.title: fix: tooltip behaviour on web
issue.body:
<!-- Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->
<!-- Keep pull requests small and focused on a single change. -->

### Motivation

Improper handling of  timeout IDs in `onHoverIn` and `onHoverOut` in `Tooltip` component, causing invalid behaviour and sometimes getting stuck with open tooltips (described in https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/issues/4139#issuecomment-1780617238)

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

### Related issue

See #4139 

<!-- If this pull request addresses an existing issue, link to the issue. If an issue is not present, describe the issue here. -->

### Test plan

<!-- Describe the **steps to test this change**, so that a reviewer can verify it. Provide screenshots or videos if the change affects UI. -->

<!-- Keep in mind that PR changes must pass lint, typescript and tests. -->

issue.title: Tooltip on web is not working properly since version `5.7.1`.
issue.body: ### Current behaviour I'm using version `5.7.0` and all works fine. When I hover over something, the tooltip shows, and then it goes away when I stop hovering. It also works with the delays. Since version `5.7.1` my tooltips just behave very strange. Even if I stop hovering, it still shows after the delay. So I keep up ending with multiple tooltips showing. ### Expected behaviour To work as it does in `5.7.0`. When hover it shows, when not hovering, it goes away. ### How to reproduce? Easy, just try to hover the icons in this Snack. https://snack.expo.dev/@fyranollfyra/tooltip-not-working If I remove the `onPress` on the `IconButton` everything works as expected. ### Preview ### What have you tried so far? Just tried different versions and found ### Your Environment | software | version | --------------------- | ------- | react-native | 0.71.3 | react-native-paper | 5.7.1 (5.7.0) | node | 18.15.0 | yarn | 1.22.19 | expo sdk | 48.0.20

comment.body: Due to the fact that `Tooltip` in react-native-web passes down its `webPressProps` down both to a `Pressable` that wraps the child and to the child component itself: https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/blob/aebeabd8769988b17bb56b0f5673f252e1bda0d9/src/components/Tooltip/Tooltip.tsx#L207-L216 it is possible for a race condition that breaks the expected behaviour to occur, given three conditions are fulfilled: - the `Tooltip`'s `children` prop is a component that finally passes its `onHoverIn` prop down to a `Pressable`, which is the case in @mathias-berg's situation, or performs equivalent behaviour in a different way - the `Tooltip` is passed a reasonably large `enterTouchDelay` value (`1800`ms taken from this issue is enough for the bug to be reproducible) - at the same time `leaveTouchDelay` is reasonably smaller than the `enterTouchDelay` (which in the reported case is the default value of `500`ms, which is suitable for `enterTouchDelay={1800}`) Consider a situation when `handleTouchStart` is being called from `Tooltip`'s `Pressable` wrapper sets a "show tooltip" timer : https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/blob/aebeabd8769988b17bb56b0f5673f252e1bda0d9/src/components/Tooltip/Tooltip.tsx#L127-L132 and is immediately overwritten by a consecutive call to this callback from the child itself, which is passed that same callback (the passing of that prop is a desired behaviour, otherwise the child component would be ripped of a way to handle this event). Now it is easy to imagine that with a sufficiently long `enterTouchDelay` and sufficiently smaller `leaveTouchDelay` it is possible that a first delayed "show tooltip" timeout that id of was overwritten by the second invocation, would not be cleared in `handleTouchEnd` (which would clear only the second, newest, timeout) and thus "show tooltip" would fire at the very last, not being reversed at all within this interaction. A fix for that would be to make refs hold arrays of timeout IDs instead of a single ID and clear all of them each time such a clearing is performed now. This is the result with additional logging of the IDs of timeouts set & cleared:

issue.title: Performance of view and text more than 50% improvement in performance
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I find that sometimes when I render a lot of text components or other stuff on Android the performance is degraded. Especially in react native paper dates where I will also test out it this optimisation soon 
https://github.com/web-ridge/react-native-paper-dates/issues/67

**Describe the solution you'd like**
- A new Text/View component which is used internally for a lot of the components which uses the native views directly:
- Using React.memo in all components

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Forking react-native-paper

**Additional context**
https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219
https://twitter.com/todor_one/status/1421419537673723907
https://twitter.com/wcandillon/status/1421421507662725121

issue.title: Card elevation is not working properly
issue.body:
### Current behaviour
I upgraded my react native 0.63.4 to 0.71.6 but the react native paper card elevation props not working properly. outlined props worked but elevated default prop not elevated the card in the react native paper.

### Expected behaviour
Card need to be elevated 

### How to reproduce?
<!-- Help us to reproduce the issue and describe the steps -->
<!-- Attach code example on snack.expo.dev or in a GitHub repo -->

### Preview
**Before Update**
![1695111778343](https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/assets/80248449/51edd9df-20e1-4cf7-8022-931c192b197a)

**After Updated:**
![Screenshot_20230919_134353](https://github.com/callstack/react-native-paper/assets/80248449/3d3e74b1-0abc-4710-bc10-5b7a9be71afd)


### What have you tried so far?
1. Tried to change the different version of react native paper. it won't help to elevated the card.
2. Outlined prop is working but elevated prop won't work.
3. Try to <Card.Content> based on the latest version document but it won't elevated.

### Your Environment

| software                      | version
| --------------------- | -------
| react-native                | 0.71.6
| react-native-paper    | 4.0.0
| node                            | 16.13.0
| npm or yarn                | yarn 1.22.19

comment.body: Hello 👋, this issue has been open for more than a month without a repro or any activity. If the issue is still present in the latest version, please provide a repro or leave a comment within 7 days to keep it open, otherwise it will be closed automatically. If you found a solution or workaround for the issue, please comment here for others to find. If this issue is critical for you, please consider sending a pull request to fix it.

issue.title: Web Build Error: Unable to resolve "../Utilities/Platform" from "node_modules/react-native/Libraries/ReactNative/PaperUIManager.js"
issue.body:
### Current behavior
When including  `<PaperProvider` in the root of my expo appI get the following error:
`Unable to resolve "../Utilities/Platform" from "node_modules/react-native/Libraries/ReactNative/PaperUIManager.js"`

### Expected behavior
The project finishes web bundling

### How to reproduce?
Create an expo project (https://docs.expo.dev/workflow/web/)
Enable metro as the build tool (https://docs.expo.dev/guides/customizing-metro/)
Add Paper
`expo start` 
Press `w` in the terminal to open the web build

### What have you tried so far?
Looked into the issue, and there is a `node_modules/react-native/Libraries/Utilities/Platform.ios.js` and a `node_modules/react-native/Libraries/Utilities/Platform.android.js`, but there is no Platform.js so it fails when trying to build on web

I'm at a loss of what to try.  I see other issues on here by people successfully running paper on expo 49, but I'm not sure how it works for them at all.  I'm not aware of build settings to replace files that don't exist.

### Your Environment

| software                      | version
| --------------------- | -------
| ios                                | n/a
| android                        | n/a
| react-native                | 0.72.3
| react-native-paper    | ^5.11.1
| node                            | 18.16.0
| npm or yarn                | pnpm
| expo sdk                     | 49

issue.body:
### Ask your Question
How can customize the theme font?
I cannot find the details to customize the theme font in the document.
https://callstack.github.io/react-native-paper/fonts.html

The old (v3) document shows the way to customize the theme font. But it does not work on v5.
https://callstack.github.io/react-native-paper/3.0/fonts.html

comment.body: PLEASE update documentation to reflect this.  It's very unclear.  🙏🙏🙏🙏

`Unable to resolve "../Utilities/Platform" from "node_modules/react-native/Libraries/ReactNative/PaperUIManager.js"`

### Expected behavior

Create an expo project (https://docs.expo.dev/workflow/web/)

Press `w` in the terminal to open the web build

issue.title: List.Accordion: Can we change color of up arrow when its expanded ?
issue.body:
Hello,
is there a way to change color of up and down arrow for List.Accordion component? 

currently when the item is expanded it shows the upward arrow. I need to change color of up arrow when its expanded only. 

Thanks
